text.tspan: Blue and Red Squares are Portals
Blue lines are obsticles that the player cannot pass through, but the teatank can
Red lines stop the teatank untill the player pushes a button to release it.
Green lines cause the teatank to speed up/ accelerate (not just a temporary speed boost, but causes it to travel faster permanatly)
Yellow lines cause the teatank to slow down permanately.
Stars represent the beginnning and end of the level
Red circles are buttons to be pressed by the player (in this level, they could be replaced by switches on the wall, or something similar).
Teatank starts here.
Room 1:
This is the first room in the game
the player should be given a little bit of time before the
teatank comes out of its hole, (or crack in the wall or whatever
Room 2:
This room should be there only for the player to see what he/she
is leaving in following the teatank (an old life, factory workplace, or something
similar.
The player should die, and/or the game should end if they stay too long
in this room
Room 3:
This room is just to demonstrate that the teatank can stop, and that the
user needs to push the button to let the teatank continue
Room 4:
The gray circle is a turntable, the black box is a short wall, just high enough
to stop the teatank The teatank should roll onto the turntable, then be stopped
by the wall. When the teatank is stopped, it should beep, or otherwise let the
player know that it has been stopped, then after a short period of time, shutdown,
explode, or otherwise make it so that It will fail the mission (the player can't open
the exit door without the wirelless transmitter inside the teatank) if the player pushes
the button, the turntable turns, and the wall lowers, letting the teatank continue to
the next room.
Room 5:
This room meerly demonstrates what portals are. the blue wall is there just so that
the player doesn't charge through the portal without seeing the teatank go through
first, this makes sure that the player has a full understanding of what portals are.
Room 6:
The teatank gets stopped by the barrier, when the user pushes the button the
teatank goes into the portal and ends up on the other side of the barrier.
(See Diagram)
Diagram of Portals in Room 6
Overall Level Discriopton:
The user walks into a room, it it obvious that he should go through the
door in front of him, The user is given a chance to look into the room,
but then a sound should make him turn around (or flash of light or something)
He then should see a teatank roll out of a crack in the wall, it will cross the room
and then go into a different room, it should be obvious to the player that the place
where the teatank is rolling is NOT disigned for the character to go into, (e.g. signs
saying "danger", "no entry" etc.) The player should the have to follow the teatank
through the level, at different points through the level, the user will have to do something
to "assist" the teatank, such as lowering a barrer or turning a turntable.
Art:
I give the artist almost complete artistic freedom with this level, pretty much anything
goes, however, it should seem as if these rooms were specificly made for the teatank to travel
through. (maybe a track on the floor keeping the teatank pointing in the right direction)
and not the teatank "intruding" on rooms made for different purposes.
It should also be apparent (at least in this level) that the rooms were designed to have someone
help the teatank along
Room 7:
This room just has a size changing portal and a hole in the wall that is too small for the
teatank and player to go through, after going through the portal, the become small enough
to fit through the small hole
Room 8:
Same as room 7, but instead the portal restores the player and teatank to their original size.
Room 9:
This is a "three corned square" room, the portals make it seem as if the room is distorted
feel free to have the teatank circle around a bit in this room to give the player the full
feeling of this effect.
Room 10:
This just houses the "go to next level teleporter" ie. what the user has to get into to end the
level, teleporter shouldn't work unless the teatank has already been in it. (so the player
cannot complete the level unless he gets the teatank to the end
